name: SENTIDO Phenicia

reviews.title: Phenicia is phantastic
reviews.text: Just returned from the Phenicia Hotel after a 1 week stay to celebrate our honeymoon. We wanted a chance to relax, unwind, eat good food and do little else but sunbathe - we got all these plus a few extras. The hotel is excellent, spotless clean and staff are very friendly and go out of their way to be helpful (like fitting a piece of paper in key slot in order to keep the air-conditioning on constant). The food is fabulous (we came home more than a few pounds heavier). The facilities offered are very good and the entertainment team work non-stop trying to include all guests in their programmes. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.
Stayed at this hotel for two weeks end of June early July (4 adults).
reviews.title: Loved the Phenicia Hotel
over rated+bad experience
reviews.text: Could not fault the hotel in any major way. The animation team work very hard throught that day and evening. The food was not always to my liking, but i always found something to eat. The staff are very friendly, but dont forget to tip Mario the sunbed man and he'll look after you. I found the swimming pool one of the best that i've ever been in abroad and it looked great for kids, try the bar in the centre of the pool, only one i've seen with a swimming pool within it. The rooms were great for two adults, but lack draw space, might be a bit cramped if you have children.
I could go for hours talking about this, but would sum it up by saying that the Phenicia was a wonderfull hotel and i'd go back now if i could.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday
We loved Phenicia :)
reviews.text: Well where can i start?? when i first go to the hotel with my wife we were standing for ages at the reception waiting to check in, not because it was busy, but because they were still cleaning our room which somebody had just left so we weren't very happy about it specially when the room needs airing a bit, once we went up to our rooms the toilets looked filthy and you could just tell somebody had just paid a visit not long before we go the room!! the bed sheets had cigarett burns in and smelt awfull even though i stressed to the travel agent when booking the hotel that me and my wife wanted a non smoking room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 1 week all inclusive at the Phenicia......it was a very beautiful large spacious hotel with gorgeous swimming pools and it's very own beach which was just a short stroll through the grounds , past the outside restaurant and bar. The water was shallow and warm and the sand soft and clean...the sunbeds are managed by a very sweet old guy who empties the many bins and shoo's away sellers that can be a bit of a hassle after a while.
reviews.title: Such a Lovely hotel!

likes.liked: — friendly staff and very large clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The all inclusive food was a good standard and plentiful. There were snacks served in between main meals too (hell on your waistband!)
reviews.title: Horiible

reviews.text: Our room was very clean and spacious but we had a miserable view of solar panels (distant view was better) The maid was fabulous and would arrange our bedding in a different design every day..even putting petals onto the bed on one occasion.
reviews.title: very honest review!

likes.disliked: — location to get to any historic sites or medinas

reviews.title: LOVELY HOTEL, GREAT FOOD, ATTENTIVE STAFF
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and a bit of tipping goes a long way!
There are cleaners always about keeping the areas tidy and the toilets around the complex were always spotless.
reviews.title: did it loved it
Disappointing!
reviews.text: We have just returned from our holiday at the hotel Iberostar Phenica. We were expecting more from this hotel after reading so many good reviews on Tripadvisor. But we were quite disappointed. I traveled with my husband and our three year old son.

I would firstly like to mention the positive things about it which were few: Our room was clean, the pools were clean, the food was ok (but very repetitive, not what you would expect at a 5 star hotel), sandy beach which is very clean and warm and directly accessible from the hotel (for us, the beach was the best thing about this hotel).
reviews.title: Had An Excellent Time!!!!!!

likes.liked: — The Hotel Grounds, and the entertainment

reviews.text: But our beach experience was overshadowed by the salesmen who walk up and down the beach about 50 times a day and who constantly harass you to buy their goods and each time you have to say no or look away. And you constantly have to watch out that your child will not be trampled by the camels and horses offered for a ride.
reviews.title: Wonderful !!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The beach staff is very unfriendly, inattentive and look as if they hate their job. When I mentioned to one of them (in my scarce French because that seems to be the only foreign language they speak in Tunisia!) that I didn't find it correct that some guests reserved the loungers and then went away and left them for several hours and we have to sit at the very back of the beach with our three year old, he got very agressive. Very menacing indeed! I think he felt threatened because it was obvious that many guests were paying him for reserving the loungers for them. The staff (apart from the main restaurant staff with very fake smiles) were not very friendly and sometimes downright ignored you when you asked them for something.
reviews.title: Best hotel i've stayed in!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went for a back massage in the beauty salon and again the masseuse was very unfriendly (she kept on having a conversation in Arabic with her colleague next door and completely ignored me) and the hygiene standards there were very low.
reviews.title: What a Hotel, Loved Every Minute!!!!

likes.disliked: — SOME OF THE MEN ARE QUITE SLEAZY

reviews.text: this is simply the best hotel in tunisia. My mother told me that last time she went to tunisia, the staff in the hotel were awful.
reviews.title: not what you think

reviews.text: however, this is not true.they would talk to you,make jokes with you and ask if you are ok.
reviews.title: lovely hoilday and hotel

likes.disliked: — no food avialble after teatime 9pm( not to my knowledge could be due to the winter)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being all inclusive may stir you.you may think of Rough people going mad on the booze,leaving cups behind and making mess.
reviews.title: Had a great week at the Phenicia

reviews.text: Believe me, it is not like that.
reviews.title: Great Late Break I would Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No grizzling babies around the pool but utter silence.The food is yummy.with spag-bol for the younger ones andone free evening in an a la carte restraunt.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic, very high standards, great food and drink

likes.liked: — Can't narrow it down, everything was fantastic!
likes.disliked: — The did turn the Air Con off in the room after 22nd September

description: Beautifully situated on the East coast of Tunisia, SENTIDO Phenicia spreads between a fine sandy beach and a garden of 11 hectares where mix generously Palm and Olive trees. For your comfort, the rooms of the hotel all endowed with balconies or terraces offer you fantastic views between the gulf and mountains of Hammamet, swimming pools, or gardens.
